required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a Personalized Diet on Cardiometabolic, Microbiome and Metabolomics Profiles in Minority Young Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Personalized Functional Food Diet on Cardiometabolic, Microbiome and Metabolomics Profiles in Minority Young Adults

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities (NIMHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The proposed study has two primary objectives i.e. to examine how improvements in diet quality via a personalized dietary intervention 1) benefit cardiometabolic outcomes in young Black adults differentially compared to non-Hispanic White adults, and 2) improve carbohydrate and lipid metabolism in relation to the gut microbiome.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is an 8-wk randomized, controlled, parallel arm clinical trial in which participants (age: 18-35 years, BMI: 25-45 kg/m2, race/ethnicity: Black or White) will be block randomized to a personalized dietary intervention or to receive conventional dietary advice. Outcomes assessed will include metabolites involved in carbohydrate and lipid regulation, gut microbiome composition, and cardiometabolic biomarkers.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in relative intensities of metabolites in blood
primary_outcome.description: Measured by untargeted metabolomics mass spectrometry
Assessed via a 2-hour oral glucose tolerance test
MCP-1,IL6, IL10, TNFa, hs-CRP, and fibrinogen

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 2 weeks over the 8 week intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Body mass will be measured in kg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 2 weeks over the 8 week intervention
Every 2 weeks over the 8 week intervention
Baseline and at the end of the 8-week intervention
Every 4 weeks over the 8 week intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective ratings using visual analog scales

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 4 weeks over the 8 week intervention
Every 2 weeks over the 8 week intervention
Every 2 weeks over the 8 week intervention

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of the 8-week intervention
Baseline and at the end of the 8-week intervention

arm_group.description: Young Black adults in this group will receive tailored nutrition counseling from a dietitian. To facilitate meeting their dietary goals, participants will be provided with nuts, fruits, and vegetables.

Young White adults in this group will receive tailored nutrition counseling from a dietitian. To facilitate meeting their dietary goals, participants will be provided with nuts, fruits, and vegetables.
Young Black adults will receive non-personalized, conventional dietary advice based on the MyPlate guidelines.
Young White adults will receive non-personalized, conventional dietary advice based on the MyPlate guidelines.

intervention.description: Participants in this group will receive tailored nutrition counseling from a dietitian. To facilitate meeting these dietary goals, participants will be provided with nuts, fruits, and vegetables.
Participants in the CD group will receive non-personalized, conventional dietary advice by a dietitian based on the MyPlate guidelines.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Age: 18-35 years of age
- BMI: 25-45 kg/m2
- Black including those of Hispanic ethnicity, and Non-Hispanic White individuals
- Willingness to consume nuts, fruits and vegetables
- Willing to comply with study protocol
- Consistent diet and activity patterns for 4 weeks
- Weight stable (≤5 kg change over the last 3 months) (Self-reported)
- Non-smoker >1 year or more
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergies to fruits, vegetables, and nuts provided in the study
- Illicit drug use
- Recent start of medications that affect metabolism or appetite
- Antibiotics
- Coronary artery disease, peripheral artery disease, congestive heart failure, or dyslipidemia requiring drug therapy
- Uncontrolled hypertension and blood pressure ≥ 180/110 Diabetes
- Gastrointestinal disease and/or bariatric surgery
- HIV positivity
- Pregnant or lactating individuals

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported here after deidentification (ie; text, tables, figures, and appendices)
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Immediately following publication. No end date.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data will be deposited in NIH supported data repositories.
